chargeHist.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel J. Sanders was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Pay restitution in the amount of $54,037.26 and restitution surcharge. 
-----------------------------------

Pay court costs.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment may be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
-----------------------------------

IT IS HEREBY ORDERED THAT the defendant's excess work release funds be applied to any & all outstanding Court obligations while serving his mandatory jail sentence.
-----------------------------------

No alcohol.   No illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.   No contact with victim without victim's and probation agent's consent.    Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.
-----------------------------------

Counseling as recommended by Probation Agent.   Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge.   The defendant must pay Department of Corrections Supervision fees.
-----------------------------------

AODA assessment and follow through with recommendations.
-----------------------------------

timeConds.notes:
to commence on or before 07/15/2016 at 8:00 a.m. and with work release privileges. 
*Ninety (90)  days of the nine (9) months are STAYED for the use of the Agent.

superMiscConds.notes: Pay restitution in the amount of $57,608.26 and restitution surcharge.

-----------------------------------

-----------------------------------

Temporary Commitment form filed

Defendant Daniel J. Sanders in court, in custody with attorney Julia Marie May.  Matthew R. Leusink appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court in session @ 3:08 p.m. Appearances made. Matter before the Court for sentencing after revocation on both files - 2015CF000246 & 2016CF000158. Record by Atty. May as to joint agreement of the parties. State has complied with victim's rights and is ready to proceed to sentencing. 
3:10 p.m. - Record by Atty. May as to background of revocation and agreed upon sentence. 
3:11 p.m. - Defendant has a written statement for the court and asks Atty. May to read it into the record for the Court.
3:14 p.m. - Record by the Court as to sentencing factors. Court addresses defendant who responds to Court's questions. Court finds joint recommendation appropriate in this situation and is in line with Probation's recommendation. Based on record Court adopts recommendation of the parties, and sentences the defendant as requested:

One (1) year of Initial Confinement followed by three (3) years Extended Supervision on EACH COUNT CONCURRENT
DEAD TIME CREDIT: 
419 days on file 15CF246 
218 days on file 16CF158

Conditions of Extended Supervision are the same as the conditions of Probation.
Parties have nothing further. Court in recess.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on February 22, 2018 at 11:00 am.
AMENDED 01/19/2018
Violation/Revocation Summary.

TOTAL BOND COVERS ALL FILES 15GF1152, 15CF246 & 16GF334
MUST BE CO-SIGNED BY DONNA SKIBBA
DEFENDANT MUST RESIDE WITH GRANDMOTHER (DONNA SKIBBE)
  Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol.  Defendant shall have "0" blood alcohol in his/her body whenever driving/operating a motor vehicle.  Defendant shall not drive a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.  Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH T.L.   Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
